decimal_to_binary.lesson: Decimal to Binary Conversion lesson. Goal: Convert decimal numbers into correct binary representations. Use powers of two place values: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32. A 1 includes that place value; a 0 excludes it. Rule summary: divide by 2, track remainder, reverse order, verify.

Decimal to Binary Conversion lesson. Goal: Convert decimal numbers into correct binary representations. Use powers of two place values: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32. A 1 includes that place value; a 0 excludes it. Rule summary: divide by 2, track remainder, reverse order, verify. Your turn: convert 10 to binary, then check your answer. Quick quiz: what binary equals decimal 19?

Decimal to Binary Conversion lesson. Goal: Convert decimal numbers into correct binary representations. After collecting remainders, read them in reverse order. Bottom-to-top order gives the binary answer. Example: 13 -> remainders 1, 0, 1, 1; reverse gives 1101. Check: 1101 = 8 + 4 + 1 = 13. Your turn: convert 10 to binary, then check your answer. Quick quiz:

Decimal to Binary Conversion lesson. Goal: Convert decimal numbers into correct binary representations. After collecting remainders, read them in reverse order. Bottom-to-top order gives the binary answer. Common mistake: writing remainders in forward order. Common mistake: stopping before quotient reaches 0.
